metadata.name: Eucalyptus 1940/2022 #1
metadata.description:
# *The Calder Question* - Season 1

Calder Foundation and TRLab have joined forces with two-time Emmy® Award-winning motion designer Raoul Marks to create 5 limited edition NFT artworks for Season 1 of The Calder Question based on these 5 Calder mobiles:

\- Vertical Foliage, 1941

\- Eucalyptus, 1940

\- Snow Flurry, 1948

\- Tines, 1943

\- Untitled, 1956

Raoul Marks: "*Eucalyptus* instantly drew me to the esoteric curves of its numerous forms, in particular the lowermost element. Exploring the wake of this element as it moves through a void suggested grand arcs on a cosmic scale. Trying to capture the space carved out by its motion served as the backbone for this work. There’s also a delicate interplay of the staggered spears in the upper quadrant of *Eucalyptus*—the way they echo each other suggested a single element observed over time. I’m always intrigued by how Calder’s work seems to bend space. For me, trying to capture a version of that distortion of perception was key in translating how this work made me feel."
